post.summary: Requests a Bearer Token to use as Authentication for subsequent requests
post.description: This call will request a Bearer Token as part of the OAuth flow used by the API

grant_type.description: The OAuth 2.0 grant type being requested. Currently the API only supposes the Client Credentials flow.

client_id.description: The ID assigned to your Client in the Scorebuddy application. This is created based on the human-readable name of the client created by the developer

client_secret.description: The Secret assigned to your Client in the Scorebuddy application

scope.description: Space separated list of scopes you wish to create a Bearer Token for. A common mistake is to comma separate the scopes, however only space separated scopes are accepted.
scope.example: staff:read users:read teams:read groups:read scores:read scorecards:read

token_type.description: The type of token received. As the Scorebuddy API currently only accepts the Client Credentials flow, this will always be "Bearer".

expires_in.description: The number of seconds, from the moment of generation forward, that the token will be valid for. Currently there are no restrictions on generating subsequent tokens, but generating them only as their expiry requires is preferred.

access_token.description: The JSON Web Token to pass back as the Bearer token for subsequent requests, that require authorisation.

get.summary: Checks if the server is alive and returns current rate limit statistics
get.description: This call will check if the server is alive and returns current rate limit statistics.

X-RateLimit-Remaining.description: The number of requests left for the time window.

X-RateLimit-Reset.description: The UTC date/time at which the current rate limit window resets.

get.description:
This call will request Scores from Scorebuddy. This would be the primary end-point to use for extracting Score data from Scorebuddy, into a data-mining system. Manipulation of the `from_last_edit_date` and `to_last_edit_date` filters to gather latest data is recommended.

See `/scores/{score_id}` for relevant data links.

parameters.name: from_score_date
parameters.description: Start Event datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as from __and__ including.

parameters.name: to_score_date
parameters.description: End Event datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as to __and__ including.

parameters.name: from_event_date
parameters.description: Start Call datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS. Operates as from __and__ including.

parameters.name: to_event_date
parameters.description: End Call datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD HH-MM-SS. Operates as to __and__ including.

parameters.name: from_last_edit_date
parameters.description: Start Last Edit datetime to search in. Operates as from __and__ including.

parameters.name: to_last_edit_date
parameters.description: End Last Edit datetime to search in. Operates as to __and__ including.

parameters.name: staff_id
parameters.description: Staff ID of the member of Staff who was Scored.

parameters.name: supervisor_id
parameters.description: Staff ID of the Supervisor of whomever was Scored.

parameters.name: evaluator_id
parameters.description: User ID of the User who performed the Score.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID of the member of Staff who was Scored.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Group ID of the member of Staff who was Scored.

parameters.name: category_id
parameters.description: Category ID of the Scorecard used to performed the Score.

parameters.name: event_id
parameters.description: Event ID of the Score.

parameters.name: sub_event_id
parameters.description: Sub Event (where one exists) of the Score.

parameters.name: scorecard_id
parameters.description: Scorecard ID of the Scorecard used to performed the Score.

parameters.name: data_tags
parameters.description: IDs of any data tags attached to the Score.

parameters.name: logical_operator
parameters.description: Whether to search that Score contains __ALL__ of the data_tags, __SOME__ of the data_tags, or __ONLY__ the data_tags provided.

scores.description: An array containing a single 'page' of Scores objects.

total.description: The number of Scores in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next 'page' of Scores. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next 'page' of Scores. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the first page.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Scores.

get.description: This call will request a specific member of Staff from Scorebuddy.

parameters.name: score_id
parameters.description: The Score ID

GetScorecardByScorecardId.description:
The `scorecard_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `scorecard_id` parameter in `GET /scorecards/{scorecard_id}`.

This will only return the most recent version of the Scorecard however, so most likely it is prefered to use `version_number` below to specify the version this Score was actually taken against.

GetVersionByVersionNumber.description: The `version_number` value returned in the response can be used as the `version_number` parameter in `GET /scorecards/{scorecard_id}/version/{version_number}`. This is the specific Version of the Scorecard that was used at time of Scoring.

GetScoredStaffByStaffID.description: The `staff_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `staff_id` parameter in `GET /staff/{staff_id}`, or if the organisation does not score Supervisors, a more specific endpoint to use would be `GET /staff/employees/{staff_id}`.

GetSupervisorBySupervisorID.description: The `supervisor_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `staff_id` parameter in `GET /staff/supervisor/{staff_id}`.

GetEvaluatorBySupervisorID.description: The `evaluator_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`, to get more information on the User who recorded the Score.

GetGroupByGroupID.description: The `group_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `group_id` parameter in `GET /groups/{group_id}`.

GetTeamByTeamID.description: The `team_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `team_id` parameter in `GET /teams/{team_id}`.

GetEventByEventID.description: The `event_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `event_id` parameter in `GET /events/{event_id}`.

GetSubEventBySubEventID.description: The `sub_event_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `sub_event_id` parameter in `GET /events/{event_id}/sub_events/{sub_event_id}`, in conjunction with the `event_id` returned in the same body.

GetCustomObjectByCustomObjectID.description:
The `custom_objects` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Custom Objects that are requested on the Scorecard that was used to record a Score.

In these objects, the `object_id` value can be used as the `object_id` parameter in `GET /scorecards/{scorecard_id}/custom_objects/{object_id}`, in conjunction with the `scorecard_id` returned in the same body.

GetDataTagByDataTagID.description:
The `custom_objects` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Custom Objects that are requested on the Scorecard that was used to record a Score.

In these objects, the `tag_ids` value is an array of integers that can be used as the `tag_id` parameter in `GET /scorecards/{scorecard_id}/custom_objects/{object_id}/data_tags/{tag_id}`, in conjunction with the `scorecard_id` returned in the same body.

GetQuestionByQuestionId.description:
The `questions` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Questions on the Scorecard, that were asked and answered when the Score was recorded.

In these objects, the `question_id` value can be used as the `question_id` parameters in the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/questions/{question_id}` endpoint to get details about the Question itself, as opposed to the various inputs filled out to answer the question. This is in conjunction with the `scorecard_id` and `version_number` parameters described above.

It is worth noting that calling the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/` endpoint will include all Question data for the Scorecard, allowing more data to be gathered with less calls than individually hitting each Question endpoint.

GetAnswerByAnswerKey.description:
The `questions` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Questions on the Scorecard, that were asked and answered when the Score was recorded.

In these objects, the `answer_key` value can be used as the `answer_key` parameter in the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/questions/{question_id}/answers/{answer_key}` endpoint to get the actual human readable Answer selected. This is in conjunction with the `scorecard_id`, `version_number`, and `question_id` parameters described above.

It is worth noting that calling the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/` endpoint will include all Answer data for the Scorecard, allowing more data to be gathered with less calls than individually hitting each Answer endpoint.

GetCauseByCauseId.description:
The `questions` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Questions on the Scorecard, that were asked and answered when the Score was recorded.

In these objects, the `cause_id` value can be used as the `cause_id` parameter in the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/questions/{question_id}/causes/{cause_id}` endpoint to get details about the Root Cause Analysis that was selected at time of Scoring. This is in conjunction with the `scorecard_id`, `version_number`, and `question_id` parameters described above.

It is worth noting that calling the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/versions/{version}/` endpoint will include all Root Cause Analysis data for the Scorecard, allowing more data to be gathered with less calls than individually hitting each Cause endpoint.

GetCommentByCommentId.description:
The `questions` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Questions on the Scorecard, that were asked and answered when the Score was recorded.

In these objects, the `comment_id` value can be used as the `comment_id` parameter in the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/comments/{comment_id}` endpoint to get details of a __pre-canned__ comment that may have been selected at time of Scoring. This is not to be confused with Freetext Comments which can also be left, but will be contained within the `free_text_comment` value in the same object.

It is worth noting that calling the `/scorecards/{scorecard_id}/comments` endpoint will include all Pre-canned Comments data for the Scorecard, allowing more data to be gathered with less calls than individually hitting each Comment endpoint.

GetCommenterByCommenterId.description:
The `comments` value returned in the response is an array of objects describing each of the Final Comments that were left at the bottom of the Scorecard at time of Scoring (as opposed to the inline Comments that may have been left on an individual Question).

In these objects, the `commenter_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`, to get more information on the User who recorded the Comment.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to this Score.

404.description: A Score with the specified ID was not found.

get.description: This call will request scores Reviews from Scorebuddy. This would be the primary end-point to use for extracting score Reviews data from Scorebuddy, into a data-mining system. Manipulation of the `from_review_date` and `to_review_date` filters to gather latest data is recommended.

parameters.name: from_review_date
parameters.description: Start Review datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as from __and__ including.

parameters.name: to_review_date
parameters.description: End Review datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as to __and__ including.

parameters.name: staff_id
parameters.description: Staff ID of the member of Staff who was Scored.

reviews.description: An array containing a single 'page' of Review objects.

total.description: The number of Reviews in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next 'page' of Scores. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next 'page' of Scores. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the first page.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Scores.

get.description: This call will request a data Export from Scorebuddy. The time frame which can be requested in a single request is __maximum 31 days__. If no date range is given in the call, the last 31 days will be returned. Where a staff member has been hard deleted, the `first_name`, `last_name` and `external_id` for their scores will display as `Deleted User`. The available columns map to the export used over here - https://www.{server_name}.scorebuddy.co.uk/{instance_id}/export.php. This endpoint also uses a modern attribute naming convention as opposed to legacy naming conventions which are not supported by the API.

parameters.name: from_last_edit_date
parameters.description: Start Event datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as from __and__ including. If no `to_last_edit_date` value is provided, the server will automatically set it to 31 days in advance of the given `from_last_edit_date` value and return a `206` response code.

parameters.name: to_last_edit_date
parameters.description: End Event datetime to search in. YYYY-MM-DD. Operates as to __and__ including. If no `from_last_edit_date` value is provided, the server will automatically set it to 31 days before the given `to_last_edit_date` value and return a `206` response code.

parameters.name: group_ids
parameters.description: Array of Group IDs of the Groups the member of Staff belongs to.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: The max number of export items to display in the results

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the results

score_id.description: The ID assigned to an individual Score.

staff_id.description: The Staff ID of the member of Staff __who was scored__.

external_id.description: ID of the Staff member in the customers own HRMS. Referred to as "Staff ID" in the Scorebuddy application. This is not enforced as unique.

first_name.description: The member of Staff's first name.

last_name.description: The member of Staff's last name.

scorecard_id.description: The ID of the Scorecard the Score was recorded on.

category.description: The name of the Scorecard Category.

event_date.description: The Datetime on which the Phone Call/Email/Chat/etc being recorded occured.

group_id.description: The ID assigned to an individual Group.

evaluator.description: The name of the Evaluator of the Scorecard.

supervisor.description: The name of the Supervisor of the Individual being scored.

score_date.description: The Date on which the Score was recorded.

last_edit_date.description: The last_edit_date DateTime object representing the date on which the score was last edited.

total_score.description: The total Score earned across all Questions asked in the Score.

maximum_score_possible.description: A floating point precision number representing the maximum_score_possible on a.

target.description: Whether or not the Score was below the required Target score. This is a cached value.

question_id.description: The ID of the Question being answered.

question.example: Did they have have a good tone of voice within the email?

section_id.description: The ID assigned to an individual Section.

answer.description: String value representing the answer value.

sum.description: Integer representing the sum of the scores in a scorecard.

answer_values.description: An array containing a set of associated answer_value IDs, for example [1,2,3].

weighting.description: The Weighting assigned to this Question.

scorecard_name.description: The name of the Scorecard, for this Version.

version_number.description: The Version number of the Scorecard.

fail_section.description: Whether failing this Question, results in the entire Section failing.

fail_all.description: Whether a Fail All was trigged on any of the Questions asked in the Score. This is a cached value.

fail_all_zeros.description: Whether a Fail All results in a Score of Zero, the Score remains as it would have been despite the over all Failure.

reference.description: The Reference number recorded against the Score.

sub_event_name.description: The name of the Sub Event

event_duration.description: The Duration over which the Phone Call/Email/Chat/etc being recorded occured.

comment_ids.description: An array containing a set of associated Comment IDs, for example [101,120,121].

free_text_comments.description: An array containing a set of associated Free_text_comments.

general_comments.description: An array containing a set of associated General_comment IDs, for example ["Great answer!","Some very interesting points."].

tag_ids.description: The integer IDs that were selected if the Custom Object was a Data Tag, for example [1,2,3]

custom_text_field.description: An array containing a set of associated Custom_text_fields, for example ["FieldA","FieldB","FieldC"].

reviewed.description: Indicates whether the Scorecard has been reviewed or not.

review_date.description: The review_date DateTime object representing a point in time when the Scorecard was reviewed.

reviewed_by.description: The name of the reviewer of this Scorecard, for example "John Swan".

get.summary: Request members of Staff. Will return Employees __and__ Supervisors
get.description: This call will request member of Staff from Scorebuddy

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Group ID of the Group or one of the Groups the member of Staff belongs to.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID of the Team or one of the Teams the member of Staff belongs to.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: ID of the Staff member in the customers own HRMS. Referred to as 'Staff ID' in the Scorebuddy application. This is not enforced as unique.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: What type of Staff the Staff member is.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Whether the member of Staff is soft deleted in Scorebuddy. Not providing this filter at all will display both deleted __and__ not deleted.

parameters.name: supervisor_id
parameters.description: The 'Staff ID' of the Employee's Supervisor, if the member of Staff is an Employee.

parameters.name: agent_access
parameters.description: Whether or not the Employee has Agent Access, if the member of Staff is an Employee.

parameters.name: self_score
parameters.description: Whether or not the Employee can Self Score, if the member of Staff is an Employee.

parameters.name: employment
parameters.description: Employee's contract type, if the member of Staff is an Employee.

parameters.name: personal_goals
parameters.description: Whether or not the Employee can set Personal Goals, if the member of Staff is an Employee.

parameters.name: can_be_scored
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor can be Scored by QA Users, if the member of Staff is a Supervisor.

parameters.name: staff_access
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor can manage Employees, if the member of Staff is a Supervisor.

parameters.name: read_only
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor has Read Only access, if the member of Staff is a Supervisor.

staff.description: An array containing a single "page" of Staff objects.

total.description: The number of Staff in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Staff. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Staff. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the first page.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Staff.

post.description: This call will insert an member of Staff into Scorebuddy. If the "dashboard" parameter of the request is set to "true" then an email is sent to the posted Staff member.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Staff.

put.summary: Insert or Update a member of Staff.
put.description: This call will insert a member of Staff into Scorebuddy.

206.description:
Partial Content
This code is returned when only a portion of the request could be allowed to complete. The most likely cause is the member of Staff is managed by SCIM.
This should not be confused with an error. If a portion of the request could not be completed due to technical errors, generally speaking the request will be reverted entirely and an error status code returned.
In either case you can compare the response to your request, to see what has and has not been altered.

GetTeamByTeamID.description: The `team_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `team_id` parameter in `GET /teams/{team_id}`.

GetSupervisorBySupervisorID.description: The `supervisor_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `staff_id` parameter in `GET /staff/supervisor/{staff_id}`, to get information on this Member of Staff's Supervisor, should they have one.

patch.summary: Update a specific member of Staff.
patch.description: This call will update a specific member of Staff from Scorebuddy. If the "dashboard" parameter of the request is set to "true" then an email is sent to the patched Staff member.

206.description:
Partial Content
This code is returned when only a portion of the request could be allowed to complete. The most likely cause is the Member of Staff already exists, and is managed by SCIM.
This should not be confused with an error. If a portion of the request could be be completed due to technical errors, generally speaking the request will be reverted entirely and an error status code returned.
In either case you can compare the response to your request, to see what has and has not been altered.

get.description: This call will request Supervisors from Scorebuddy.

parameters.name: group_id
parameters.description: Group ID of the Group or one of the Groups the Supervisor belongs to.

parameters.name: team_id
parameters.description: Team ID of the Team or one of the Teams the Supervisor belongs to.

parameters.name: external_id
parameters.description: ID of the Supervisor in the customers own HRMS. Referred to as 'Staff ID' in the Scorebuddy application. This is not enforced as unique.

parameters.name: role
parameters.description: What type of Supervisor the Supervisor is.

parameters.name: deleted
parameters.description: Whether the Supervisor is soft deleted in Scorebuddy. Not providing this filter at all will display both deleted __and__ not deleted.

parameters.name: can_be_scored
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor can be Scored by QA Users.

parameters.name: can_audit
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor can audit evaluators.

parameters.name: staff_access
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor can manage Employees.

parameters.name: read_only
parameters.description: Whether or not the Supervisor has Read Only access.

supervisors.description: An array containing a single "page" of Supervisor objects.

total.description: The number of Supervisors in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Supervisors. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Supervisors. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the first page.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to this Supervisors.

post.description: This call will insert a Supervisor into Scorebuddy. If the "dashboard" parameter of the request is set to "true" then an email is sent to the posted Supervisor.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Supervisors.

put.description: This call will insert a Supervisor into Scorebuddy.

206.description:
Partial Content
This code is returned when only a portion of the request could be allowed to complete. The most likely cause is the Supervisor is managed by SCIM.
This should not be confused with an error. If a portion of the request could not be completed due to technical errors, generally speaking the request will be reverted entirely and an error status code returned.
In either case you can compare the response to your request, to see what has and has not been altered.

206.description:
Partial Content
This code is returned when only a portion of the request could be allowed to complete. The most likely cause is the Supervisor already exists, and is managed by SCIM..
This should not be confused with an error. If a portion of the request could not be completed due to technical errors, generally speaking the request will be reverted entirely and an error status code returned.
In either case you can compare the response to your request, to see what has and has not been altered.

get.description:
This call will request Internal Integrations from Scorebuddy. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Interactions.

Internal Integrations represent containers for groups of Lists/Cases, preventing assets in one Internal Integration from ever being visible to Users with access to another. A practical example of their use is for Cases belonging to one client to be stored, Scored and kept away from Cases belonging to another client.

N.B. This endpoint will only return Internal Integrations created by the OpenAPI itself, and/or added as an Internal Integration in Scorebuddy itself.

integrations.description: An array containing a single "page" of Intergration objects.

total.description: The number of Integrations in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Integrations. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Integrations. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the first page.

GetGroupByGroupID.description: The `group_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `group_id` parameter in `GET /groups/{group_id}`.

GetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Integration, or the API Client if the Integration was created via the OpenAPI.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Internal Integrations.

post.description: This call will insert an Internal Integration into Scorebuddy. See `GET /integrations` for a description of Internal Integrations in Scorebuddy. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Interactions.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Internal Integrations.

put.summary: Insert or Update an Internal Integration.
put.description:
This call will insert or update an Internal Integration in Scorebuddy. See `GET /integrations` for a description of Internal Integrations in Scorebuddy. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Internal Integrations.

N.B. This endpoint will only update Internal Integrations created by the OpenAPI itself, and/or added as an Internal Integration in Scorebuddy itself.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Internal Integrations, or the request attempted to update an Internal Integration not added as an Internal Integration in Scorebuddy itself.

get.description:
This call will request Lists from Scorebuddy. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Lists.

N.B. This endpoint will only return Lists created by the OpenAPI itself, and/or the Basic Case CSV Uploader.

lists.description: An array containing a single "page" of List objects.

total.description: The number of Lists in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Lists. Paging defaults at 100. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of Lists. Paging defaults at 100. If null the pointer is on the first page.

GetIntegrationByIntegrationID.description:
The `integration_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `integration_id` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}` to get further information on the Integration this List is associated with. operationId: getIntegration parameters:
  integration_id: '$response.body#/lists/0/integration_id'

GetGroupByGroupID.description: The `group_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `group_id` parameter in `GET /groups/{group_id}`.

GetTeamByTeamID.description: The `team_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `team_id` parameter in `GET /teams/{team_id}`.

GetUserByUserId.description: The `user_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`.

GetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Lists, or the API Client if the Lists was created via the OpenAPI.

GetCaseByCaseID.description: And of the values found in the `cases` array returned in the response can be used as the `case_id` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}/cases/{case_id}`, along with the `integration_id` being found in the integration_id attribute.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Interactions.

post.description:
This call will insert a List into Scorebuddy. See `GET /integrations/{integration_id}/lists` for a description of Lists in Scorebuddy.

Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Lists, or the List was not created by the OpenAPI itself, and/or the Basic Case CSV Uploader.

get.description:
This call will request External Cases from Scorebuddy.

An External Case represents the most basic type of Case supported by Scorebuddy. The information in the Case provides the Quality Analyist with only the client-side Case ID of the Case, the external system that this Case exists in, and the Agent against whom the Case should be Scored. Use this Case type if you want absolutely no specifics to be stored in Scorebuddy itself, and simply want to point the Quality Analyist in the right direction.

Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Cases.

N.B. This endpoint will only return External Cases created by the OpenAPI itself.

total.description: The number of External Cases in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of External Cases. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of External Cases. Paging defaults at 10. If null the pointer is on the first page.

N.B. This endpoint does not return the files themselves. These are not retrievable via the API.

files.description: An array containing a single "page" of File Meta Data.

total.description: The number of Files in total that the request applies to.

next_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of File Meta Data. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the last page.

previous_page.description: The URL to call for the next "page" of File Meta Data. Paging defaults at 25. If null the pointer is on the first page.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Interactions.

get.summary: Request a specific File Meta Data.
get.description:
This call will request File Meta Data for a specified file in a given Integration.

N.B. This endpoint does not return the file itself. This is not retrievable via the API.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to this File.

404.description: A File with the specified name was not found.

post.description:
Insert a file into a given Integration, which can then be associated by name to a given file-supporting Case

The POST method will throw a 409 if a file with the specified name already exists in Scorebuddy. If you with to overwrite a known file, use PATCH, or if you wish to upsert, use PUT.

The total size of the audio files may not exceed 100mb, exceeding this will result in a 413.

Each file must be either MP3, AAC, or OGG audio data at present, to facilitate low file loads back to the Evaluator. Other file formats will result in a 415.

requestBody.description: Binary data of the file in question

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Interactions.

put.description:
Insert or Update a file into a given Integration, which can then be associated by name to a given file-supporting Case

The PUT method will either add a file if it is not found, or overwrite it if it is found. A 200 or 201 will be returned to indicate which of the two operations occured. Use POST if you want to guarantee the file does not yet exist, or PATCH if you want to be certain that it does.

The total size of the audio files may not exceed 100mb, exceeding this will result in a 413.

Each file must be either MP3, AAC, or OGG audio data at present, to facilitate low file loads back to the Evaluator. Other file formats will result in a 415.

requestBody.description: Binary data of the file in question

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to Interactions.

patch.description:
Update a given file in a given Integration, which can then be associated by name to a given file-supporting Case

The PATCH method will throw a 404 if a file with the specified name does not already exists in Scorebuddy. If you want to add the file in such an event, use PUT.

The total size of the audio files may not exceed 100mb, exceeding this will result in a 413.

Each file must be either MP3, AAC, or OGG audio data at present, to facilitate low file loads back to the Evaluator. Other file formats will result in a 415.

requestBody.description: Binary data of the file in question

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to this File.

404.description: A File with the specified name was not found.

delete.description:
This call will delete a specific File from a give Integration in Scorebuddy.

Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Integrations, or the request attempted to delete a File that does not exist.

N.B. Deleting a file does not disassociated it from a Case, if such an association has been created. This is left to the Developer.

403.description: Authorised user does not have access to this File.

404.description: A File with the specified ID was not found.

request_one_2_one.description: Whether the employee asked for a one to one for the score.

viewed.description: Whether the employee has viewed the score.

object_id.description: The ID of the Custom Object

data_retention.description: By default Scorebuddy will retain any and all Cases inserted into the system via the OpenAPI, permenantly. You can however create a set of rules to govern a default lifetime of the data.

policy.description: Whether or not the Cases added to Lists associated with this Integration, will have a default life-span. Setting this to Permanent has no effect on the data retention policies added to individual Cases via the OpenAPI.

rules.description: A time-interval and a number thereof that the date will be retained for, having been added to Scorebuddy, if a specific retention date is not provided with any given Case. This object will be `null` if the retention policy is permanent.

interval.description: The unit of time that the lifetime of the data will be measured in.

numeracy.description: How many of the intervals to pass before the data is deleted

last_updated.description: For Integrations that pull data from Integration partners, this attribute indicates the last time that pull occurred

list_type.description: The list type within the context of Scorebuddy. Generally speaking this controls how the List appears in Scorebuddy and how it can be interacted with by users.

assignment.description: Assignment is the concept of who has permission to Score a particular List. Important note, the lowest-common-denominator applies. If you set Groups and Teams, Teams will be used for enforcement. Likewise Groups and Users, Users will be used. Groups > Teams > Users.

team_ids.description: Array of Team IDs, that a User must belong to, in order to be allowed to Score this List.

user_ids.description: Array of User IDs, of Users who are allowed to Score this List. This represents the most precise restriction a List can be placed under.

external.description: This object links the case back to your own internal system. What does your system identify the Member of Staff by, and what does your system identify the Case by.

meta_data.description:
An array of Meta Data assigned to this Case. This information can be anything within reason, that the Quality Analyst may need to know in addition to the standard information required by that particular Case type. Practical examples may be Scores given by RCA Surveys, training the Agent has previously received, etc etc.

N.B. All Meta Data must be defined first via `POST/PUT integrations/{integration_id}/meta_data` in order for it to be properly indexed and assigned. Any Meta Data inserted via the Basic Case CSV Uploader will be auto-typed as a String.

name.description: The system-name for the Meta Data you wish to upload. This is as distinct from the Readable Name

value.description: The value of the Meta Data you wish to upload. This can functionality be anything, but is constrained by the rules set against the Meta Data object when it was created via `POST/PUT integrations/{integration_id}/meta_data`

messages.description:
An array of Messages that occured in the duration of this Ticket.

This object is intentioanally kept relatively Generic, but if you feel a data point is missing, feel free to reach out and we can consider expanding it, or adding a new Case type to facilitate your requirements.

The order of the messages is assumed to be the order in which they are entered into the array

An array of Messages that occured in the duration of this Email.

This object is intentioanally kept relatively Generic, but if you feel a data point is missing, feel free to reach out and we can consider expanding it, or adding a new Case type to facilitate your requirements.

The order of the messages is assumed to be the order in which they are entered into the array

An array of Messages that occured in the duration of this Chat.

This object is intentioanally kept relatively Generic, but if you feel a data point is missing, feel free to reach out and we can consider expanding it, or adding a new Case type to facilitate your requirements.

The order of the messages is assumed to be the order in which they are entered into the array

files.description:
An array of Audio Files that occured in the duration of this Voice Interaction.

This object is intentionally kept relatively Generic, but if you feel a data point is missing, feel free to reach out and we can consider expanding it, or adding a new Case type to facilitate your requirements.

The order of the files is assumed to be the order in which they are entered into the array

File Size and Mime Type will be determined on receipt.

The binary of the file is not returned in this or any Endpoint

An array of Audio Files that occured in the duration of this Voice Interaction.

This object is intentionally kept relatively Generic, but if you feel a data point is missing, feel free to reach out and we can consider expanding it, or adding a new Case type to facilitate your requirements.

The order of the files is assumed to be the order in which they are entered into the array

The binary of the file is not returned in this or any Endpoint

ai_text.description:
An array of Objects that each describe one Language of text of this Interaction.

For Audio cases, this Language may have been created by Transcription. For all other Cases, and previously Transcribed Audio Cases, the Language may have been created by Translation.

The key of each Language is denoted by an ISO 639 language code.

iso_code.description: N.B. Will not actually be "iso_code" but in fact the actual ISO 639 code of a given language

message_id.description: A unique ID for this particular message, as distinct from the ID for the ticket thread itself

title.description: Most Ticket systems allow a per-message title to be request
title.example: I still cannot get this thing working

body.example: I have tried absolutely everything you have suggested, and still no luck

body_format.description: Whether or not the message is in HTML or Plain Text. Plain Text will be largely displayed as-is, in Scorebuddy, however HTML will be heavily filtered for XSS etc reasons on entry into Scorebuddy.

sender_id.description:
The ID of the party who sent this particular message. This is the ID as far as your own systems are concerned.

In the case of it being sent by your own Staff Member, use the same ID as can be found in the `external.staff_id` object sent in this Case. If this ID matches that one, Scorebuddy will highlight this message in order to make it more obvious to Scorer that this is the Staff Member who is being Scored, as opposed to any other Staff Members who may have interacted with this ticket.

sender_role.description: Was the message sent by an Staff Member (i.e. an Agent on behalf of your Organisation) or was it sent by the Customer or Customers with which they are dealing?

sender_name.description:
The name of the sender as per your own system.

If this is the Staff Member, this name may be ignored in favour of the name in Scorebuddy, when displaying the Case for scoring.

If this is the Customer name, and you are concerned about GDPR or any other privilacy matter, you can either leave this null, or enter a false name. If left null, the sender_id will be used.

sent_at.description: The 'DateTime' of when this Message was inserted into your Ticket Management System.

message_id.description: A unique ID for this particular email, as distinct from the ID for the ticket thread itself. RFC 5322 specifies that all emails carry a message-id, however this does not necassarily need to be mapped to this ID, if your system has a preferential ID (such as that assigned by an internal CRM).

subject.description: Most email systems require a per-message subject to be input. This is not treated as a required field.
subject.example: I still cannot get this thing working

body.example: I have tried absolutely everything you have suggested, and still no luck

body_format.description: Whether or not the email is in HTML or Plain Text. Plain Text will be largely displayed as-is, in Scorebuddy, however HTML will be heavily filtered for XSS etc reasons on entry into Scorebuddy.

sender_id.description:
The ID of the party who sent this particular email. This is the ID as far as your own systems are concerned. It can be the senders email address, however please be aware that this is already facilitated by it's own field below.

In the case of it being sent by your own Staff Member, use the same ID as can be found in the `external.staff_id` object sent in this Case. If this ID matches that one, Scorebuddy will highlight this message in order to make it more obvious to Scorer that this is the Staff Member who is being Scored, as opposed to any other Staff Members who may have interacted with this ticket.

sender_email.description: The email address of the party who sent this particular email. This is as distinct from their ID above.

sender_role.description: Was the email sent by an Staff Member (i.e. an Agent on behalf of your Organisation) or was it sent by the Customer or Customers with which they are dealing?

sender_name.description:
The name of the sender as per your own system, or as per RFC 5322 Sender field.

If this is the Staff Member, this name may be ignored in favour of the name in Scorebuddy, when displaying the Case for scoring.

If this is the Customer name, and you are concerned about GDPR or any other privilacy matter, you can either leave this null, or enter a false name. If left null, the sender_id will be used.

sent_at.description: The 'DateTime' of when this Email was sent as per RFC 5322.

recipient_emails.description: Array of email address to whom this email was sent, i.e. the recipients. Can be empty, but must be passed as an array

carbon_copy_emails.description: Array of email address to whom this email was sent, but as a Carbon Copy (CC). Can be empty, but must be passed as an array

blind_carbon_copy_emails.description: Array of email address to whom this email was sent, but as a Blind Carbon Copy (BCC). Can be empty, but must be passed as an array

message_id.description: A unique ID for this particular message, as distinct from the ID for the chat thread itself

body.example: I have tried absolutely everything you have suggested, and still no luck

body_format.description:
Whether or not the chat message is in HTML or Plain Text. Plain Text will be largely displayed as-is, in Scorebuddy, however HTML will be heavily filtered for XSS etc reasons on entry into Scorebuddy.

If you require Markdown, please speak to your Account Manager

sender_id.description:

In the case of it being sent by your own Staff Member, use the same ID as can be found in the `external.staff_id` object sent in this Case. If this ID matches that one, Scorebuddy will highlight this message in order to make it more obvious to Scorer that this is the Staff Member who is being Scored, as opposed to any other Staff Members who may have interacted with this ticket.

sender_role.description: Was the message sent by an Staff Member (i.e. an Agent on behalf of your Organisation) or was it sent by the Customer or Customers with which they are dealing?

sender_name.description:
The name of the sender as per your own system.

If this is the Staff Member, this name may be ignored in favour of the name in Scorebuddy, when displaying the Case for scoring.

If this is the Customer name, and you are concerned about GDPR or any other privilacy matter, you can either leave this null, or enter a false name. If left null, the sender_id will be used.

sent_at.description: The 'DateTime' of when this Chat Message was inserted into your Chat Management System.

file_name.description: The file name in the format `name.ext`. Most special characters such as backslashes are not permitted

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes. The maximum size of the files is calculated across a case, not an individual file, but a single file could technically by the full allowance

mime_type.description: The type of the file. Only MP3, AAC, and OGG are allowed for file size purposes.

start_time.description: The 'DateTime' of when this audio file starts as per RFC 5322.

end_time.description: The 'DateTime' of when this audio file ends as per RFC 5322.

file_name.description: The file name in the format `name.ext`. Most special characters such as backslashes are not permitted

file_size.description: The size of the file in bytes. The maximum size of the files is calculated across a case, not an individual file, but a single file could technically by the full allowance

mime_type.description: The type of the file. Only MP3, AAC, and OGG are allowed for file size purposes.

file_name.description: The file name in the format `name.ext`. Most special characters such as backslashes are not permitted

start_time.description: The 'DateTime' of when this audio file starts as per RFC 5322.

end_time.description: The 'DateTime' of when this audio file ends as per RFC 5322.

id.description:
An ID assigned to a given section of a AI Text.

For Transcriptions, this will normally be the extent of one participant talking, until the next person talks.

side.description:
Whether the person speaking is the agent, of the customer, if this information is known.

For Transcriptions, the person who speaks first is thought to be the Agent.

start_time.description: The number of minutes and seconds, since the start of the conversation (00:00), that this piece of text began at

end_time.description: The number of minutes and seconds, since the start of the conversation (00:00), that this piece of text ends at

definition_name.description:
Definition Name is a unique identifier for a Definition, and is auto-generated from the Readable Name provided.

This will be unique for a particular Integration only. Two Meta Data definitions added to two different Integrations can have completely different types.

The basic conversion that will occure to generate the Definition Name is white spaces at the start of end of the Readable Name will be stripped out, and any white space mid-string will be reduced to a single underscore. All uppercase will be converted to lowercase.

readable_name.description:
The name of the Meta Data that will be displayed directly to the Quality Analyst when Scoring the associated Case.
This must be composed of at least 5 alphanumerical characters, and must be unique.

data_type.description:
For the most part the Type will be the most important attribute of a Meta Data Definition.

It is responsible for how the Meta Data assigned to it will be validated, how the Filters will present themselves in the List Builder, and becomes unchangable once any Meta Data has been asigned to it.

Please be aware, not all options listed may be implemented at this time, nor may the list be exhaustive. Speak to your Account Manager if none of the options listed fit your use case.

deleted.description: Whether the Meta Data definition is soft deleted in Scorebuddy.

created_by.description: The 'user_id' of the User who created the Meta Data definition. If the Meta Data object was created by the OpenAPI, it will be the 'user_id' of the Client.

created_at.description: The 'DateTime' of when the Meta Data definition was created.

oauth2.description:
See https://www.oauth.com/oauth2-servers/access-tokens/client-credentials/ for more information on the OAuth 2.O Client Credentials Flow.

For more specifics on how to request your JWT Bearer Token, see `POST /authorisation/token` in this document.

scopes.scores:read: Grants read access to Score data. N.B. This call generally returns IDs from all other data Types.
scopes.staff:read: Grants read access to Staff data
scopes.groups:read: Grants read access to Groups data
scopes.teams:read: Grants read access to Teams data
scopes.scorecards:read: Grants read access to Scorecard data
scopes.users:read: Grants read access to User data
scopes.integrations:read: Grants read access to Integration Data
scopes.integrations:write: Grants write access to Integration Data
scopes.integrations:delete: Grants delete access to Integration Data

GetUserByUserId.description: The `user_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`

IntegrationsGetGroupByGroupID.description: The `group_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `group_id` parameter in `GET /groups/{group_id}`.

IntegrationsGetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Interaction, or the API Client if the Interaction was created via the OpenAPI.

ListsGetIntegrationByIntegrationID.description: The `integration_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `integration_id` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}` to get further information on the Integration this List is associated with.

ListsGetGroupByGroupID.description: The `group_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `group_id` parameter in `GET /groups/{group_id}`.

ListsGetTeamByTeamID.description: The `team_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `team_id` parameter in `GET /teams/{team_id}`.

ListsGetUserByUserId.description: The `user_ids` value returned in the response is an array of integers that can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`.

ListsGetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the List, or the API Client if the List was created via the OpenAPI.

ListsGetCaseByCaseID.description: And of the values found in the `cases` array returned in the response can be used as the `case_id` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}/cases/{case_id}`, along with the `integration_id` being found in the integration_id attribute.

CasesGetStaffByStaffID.description: The `staff_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `staff_id` parameter in `GET /staff/{staff_id}`, or if the organisation does not score Supervisors, a more specific endpoint to use would be `GET /staff/employees/{staff_id}`.

CasesGetStaffByStaffIDGetAll.description: The `staff_id` value returned in the response can be used as the `staff_id` parameter in `GET /staff/{staff_id}`, or if the organisation does not score Supervisors, a more specific endpoint to use would be `GET /staff/employees/{staff_id}`.

CasesGetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Case, or the API Client if the Case was created via the OpenAPI.

CasesGetUserByCreatedByGetAll.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Case, or the API Client if the Case was created via the OpenAPI.

CasesGetMetaDataDefinitionByName.description: The `name` parameter in each of the objects in the `meta_data` array can be used as the `definition_name` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}/meta_data/{definition_name}`. The `integration_id` is taken from the param of this request.

CasesGetMetaDataDefinitionByNameGetAll.description: The `name` parameter in each of the objects in the `meta_data` array can be used as the `definition_name` parameter in `GET /integrations/{integration_id}/meta_data/{definition_name}`. The `integration_id` is taken from the param of this request.

MetaDataGetUserByCreatedBy.description: The `created_by` value returned in the response can be used as the `user_id` parameter in `GET /users/{user_id}`. This represents the User that created the Meta Data Definition, or the API Client if the Meta Data Definition was created via the OpenAPI.

tags.name: answers
tags.description: Calls that will return, either as parent or child, Answer objects, as they pertain to Scorecards.

tags.name: causes
tags.description: Calls that will return, either as parent or child, Causes objects, as they relate to Scorecards.

tags.name: categories
tags.description: Calls that will return Scorecard Category objects.

tags.name: comments
tags.description: Calls that will return, either as parent or child, Comment objects, as they relate to Scorecards.

tags.name: custom_objects
tags.description: Calls that will return, either as parent or child, Custom Object objects, as they related to Scorecards.

tags.name: employees
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Employees objects.

tags.name: events
tags.description: Calls that will return Event and/or Sub Event objects.

tags.name: groups
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Group objects.

tags.name: cases
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Lists objects, to store Cases. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Cases.

tags.name: lists
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Case objects. Will return a 404 if the instance does not have access to Cases.

tags.name: questions
tags.description: Calls that will return, either as parent or child, Question objects, as they related to Scorecards.

tags.name: score
tags.description: Calls that will return Score objects. ID's found in this call can be examined via the Scorecard related calls, and the two should not be confused.

tags.name: scorecards
tags.description: Calls that will return Scarecard objects. Not to be confused with Score objects. A Score is the result of filling out a Scorecard.

tags.name: sections
tags.description: Calls that will return Section objects.

tags.name: staff
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Staff objects. Not to be confused with User objects. A User manages/scores Staff.

tags.name: sub_events
tags.description: Calls that will return Sub Event objects.

tags.name: supervisors
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Supervisor objects.

tags.name: system
tags.description: Calls that related to the API itself, such as checking remaining Rate limits.

tags.name: teams
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete Team objects.

tags.name: users
tags.description: Calls that will Create, Read, Update, or Delete User objects. Not to be confused with Staff objects. A User manages/scores Staff.
